refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page documents briefly the configuration options of the Wolframe system.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: The configuration of the wolframe daemon or service is separated into sections. Some sections like 'LoadModules' always exist, others only exist if a module has been loaded.
We describe here only the standard settings which exist when no modules are loaded.
Check out the manpages of the wolframe modules wolframe-mod_XXXX5 to see the available options in 'wolframe.conf' when this module is loaded.

listitem.para: If set to 'On' the server prints the name of the server as first element of the greeting in the protocol. Possible values are 'On' or 'Off'.

Specifies how the server signature looks like when 'ServerSignature' is set to 'On'. Note: In a production environment you should be careful which information you reveal over the protocol to a possible attacker!

Possible values are:
None
Print nothing in the greeting line but the name of the software 'Wolframe'.
ProductOnly
Print the name of the product implemented in Wolframe and Wolframe itself.
Major
Print only the major version of Wolframe.
Minor
Print major and minor version of Wolframe.
Revision
Print major, minor and revision of Wolframe.
OS
Print all information, including the operating system Wolframe is running on.

refsect2.title: LoadModules
refsect2.para: The 'LoadModules' section contains directives to extend the system with loadable modules. Those can be new database modules, new scripting languages, document filters and processors, authentication/authorization/audit modules and other 3rdParty bindings, etc.

The following directives are valid in this section:
Directory module_directory
Load modules from directory module_directory instead of searching for modules in the standard system module directory of Wolframe.
Module module_name
Load module module_name. Note: You don't have to specify the module extension like '.so'.
The module_name can contain a relative path. The module path is always caculated relatively to the module_directory or to the default installation path for Wolframe modules.

refsect2.title: Logging
refsect2.para: In the 'Logging' section you can configure ways of the Wolframe server to log.
There are logging channels named 'Stderr' (for foreground mode only!), 'logFile' to log to a simple text file and 'syslog' to log to the system log.

The following directives are valid in this section:
Level log_level
Log only messages up to the level log_level. Possible log levels are 'FATAL', 'ALERT', 'CRITICAL', 'SEVERE', 'ERROR', 'WARNING', 'NOTICE', 'INFO, 'DEBUG', 'TRACE', 'DATA' or 'DATA2'.
Note: This is the only directive which must be understood by all logging channels.
Filename (logFile) file_name
Write log message to the file denoted by file_name.
Ident (syslog) ident
The syslog identifier to tag the log entries with.
Facility (syslog) ident
The syslog facility to tag the log entries with. Usual facilities are 'LOCAL0' to 'LOCAL7', 'USER', 'DAEMON' or similar.
Consult the openlog3 man page to see what facilities are available on your system.

refsect2.title: Listen
refsect2.para: The 'Listen' section deals with network settings.
You can choose between a plain socket with the 'Socket' directive or an encrypted socket with 'SSLSocket'.
Note: 'Name', 'Address', 'Port' and 'MaxConnections' are common directives for both plain and encrypted sockets.

The following directives are valid in this section:
MaxConnections max_connections
Maximum number of simultaneous connections. This limits the number of clients which can use the server in parallel. If '0' is specified for max_connections or if the directive is absent, an operating system default is choosen.
Threads max_threads
Size of the pool of threads serving client connections. The default for max_threads is 4.
Address ip_address
IP address the server should listen to incoming connections. ip_address is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address. '*' denotes any address. '0.0.0.0' any IPv4 address. ':::*' any IPv6 address. '127.0.0.1' and '::1' denote the local loopback interface for IPv4 respectively IPv6.
Port port
Defines the port where the server listens on. We usually set port to 7661 for unencrypted connections and 7961 for encrypted connections.
Name "interface_name"
You can give interfaces a name, so they can be identified as group (for instance in authentication, autorization, auditing). Naming interfaces is not required.
MaxConnections max_connections
Sets the maximum number of simultaneous connections locally for this interface.
Certificate server.crt
The server certificate to use for encrypted connections. The format of the certificate is excepted to be PEM.
Certificate server.key
The server key to use for encrypted connections. The format of the key is excepted to be PEM.
CADirectory CA_directory
A directory holding CA certificate files.
CAChainFile chain_file
The chain_file holds the CA chain which is required to verify client certificates. The format of chain_file has to be PEM.
Verify On | Off
If switched on the server requires the client to send a valid client certificate which is checked by the server.

refsect2.title: Daemon
refsect2.para: The 'Daemon' section sets the behaviour of the Wolframe server as a Unix daemon.

The following directives are valid in this section:
User user
Run the Wolframe daemon under permissions of the Unix user user.
Group group
Run the Wolframe daemon under permissions of the Unix group group.
PidFile pid_file
Where to store the PID daemon lock file. Note that pid_file must be in a location with enough rights for the user to create the PID file!

refsect2.title: Database
refsect2.para: The 'Database' section configures databases which can be used in programs, the AAAA layer, etc.
Each database module registers itself with a new section name, for instance the 'mod_db_sqlite3.so' module registers a new section named SQLite.

One parameter is supported for all database sections:
Identifier identifier
Register the configured database connection with name identifier. You can later reference it by that name when an identifier of a database connection is needed. This parameter is required.
Check out the manpages named wolframe-mod_db_XXXX5 of the specific database module you want to use for a list of database specific options.
